articles.title: Postage Stamp Marks 20th Anniversary of Kim Jong Il as NDC Chairman
articles.content:
Postage Stamp Marks 20th Anniversary of Kim Jong Il as NDC Chairman
 Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- The State Stamp Bureau of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea issued a new stamp in commemoration of the 20th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission (NDC).
					 Seen on the upper part of the stamp are inscriptions reading "Commemoration of the 20th anniversary of the great leader Comrade Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission" and "Juche 82 (1993)-Juche 102 (2013)". 
					
					 Depicted in it are the national emblem, flag of the Workers' Party of Korea, flag of the DPRK and colors of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 As chairman of the NDC, Kim Jong Il wisely guided all state affairs, including the politics, military affairs, economy, culture, external policy and the issue of national reunification.
					
					 The 5th Session of the 12th DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, held in April last year, decided to hold him in high esteem as the eternal NDC chairman.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Establishing Cultured Practice in Production, Life
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Establishing Cultured Practice in Production, Life
 Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- It is the steadfast resolution of the Workers' Party of Korea to enable the Korean people to fully enjoy a socialist cultural life under the highly civilized conditions and environment and to make a beautiful and sound way of life prevail throughout society, Rodong Sinmun Sunday says in an editorial. 
					 It goes on:
					
					 The U.S. imperialists and south Korean warmongers have gone to extremes in their moves against the DPRK (Democratic People's Republic of Korea). 
					
					 However, the service personnel and people of the DPRK are replete with strong guts and firmly confident of victory. 
					
					 No matter what grave situation is created and no matter how desperately the enemies may work, the service personnel and people are creating a highly civilized and beautiful life at all their posts and worksites, looking forward to a rosy future. This is their proud tradition.
					
					 No force on earth can conquer them as they carve out a beautiful life for morrow full of revolutionary optimism and emotion. 
					
					 The editorial calls on all party members and other people to turn out in the drive for establishing cultured practice in production and life with ardent patriotism and turn the country into a highly civilized socialist country, more beautiful and better to live in.

articles.title: S. Korean Believers Urge "Government" to Opt for Peace
articles.content:
S. Korean Believers Urge "Government" to Opt for Peace
 Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- The National Council of Christian Churches in south Korea made public an appeal for peace on the Korean Peninsula, according to CBS of south Korea Friday.
					 The council held that the north-targeted south Korea-U.S. military exercises should be halted to ensure prosperity common to the south and the north.
					
					 The present crisis was sparked because the Lee Myung Bak "government" pursued a policy of confrontation with compatriots, driving the south-north relations into catastrophe, the council asserted demanding the present regime follow a policy for peace.
					
					 The council stressed the need to hold an urgent prayer meeting and discussion to prevent a war and achieve peace.

articles.title: Day of Sun to Be Marked in Sweden
articles.content:
Day of Sun to Be Marked in Sweden
 Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- A Swedish preparatory committee was formed in Stockholm on April 2 to celebrate the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung (the Day of the Sun).
					 Christer Lundgren, chairman of the Sweden-Korea Friendship Association, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize a meeting, lecture and other diverse political and cultural events from April 5 to 15.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Lauded by Russian, Bangladeshi Papers
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Lauded by Russian, Bangladeshi Papers
 Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- Russian and Bangladeshi papers carried special write-ups to mark the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The March 26th issue of the Russian paper Komsomolskaya Pravda carried an article titled "Succession to socialist cause in DPRK" illustrated with portraits of smiling Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il, a portrait of the dear respected Kim Jong Un and pictures showing undying feats of the great men of Mt. Paektu.
					
					 Kim Il Sung led the Korean revolution for a long period, laying a solid foundation for the socialist cause, the article said, and went on:
					
					 The President turned the DPRK into a socialist power, independent in politics, self-supporting in the economy and self-reliant in national defence.
					
					 The DPRK could make steady progress as he firmly equipped all people with the idea of socialism and wisely led them to remain intensely loyal to its cause.
					
					 He is praised as the founding father of socialist Korea.
					
					 The Bangladeshi paper Industry on March 24 carried an article titled "Kim Il Sung, shining august name" together with a portrait of smiling President.
					
					 It said:
					
					 The august name of the President means the sun.
					
					 His august name is shedding its rays like the sun.
					
					 The Korean revolutionaries named him Kim Il Sung in the meaning that he was the sun indicating the road of national rebirth and prosperity.
					
					 The President liberated the country through an arduous anti-Japanese armed struggle and inflicted a defeat upon the U.S. imperialists in the past Fatherland Liberation War, the first of its kind in the history, protecting the sovereignty and dignity of the country.
					
					 If the Juche idea, Songun idea founded by him can be likened to the sun illumining the road for mankind to follow, his noble virtue and moral obligation can be compared to its heat giving life to all things.
					
					 His august name is shining as a banner of eternal victory.

articles.title: Events for Celebrating Day of Sun Held in Foreign Countries
articles.content:
Events for Celebrating Day of Sun Held in Foreign Countries
 Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- Events took place in foreign countries on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Seminar on exploits, photo exhibition and film show were held in Mongolia, Singapore and Indonesia between March 28 and April 2.
					
					 Displayed in the venues of the events were photos dealing with the undying revolutionary exploits of the illustrious great men of Mt. Paektu.
					
					 Also on display there were photos showing the true picture of Songun Korea.
					
					 The chairman and vice-chairman of the Mongolian Centre for the Study of Juche said that Kim Il Sung led the two revolutionary wars to victory and turned the DPRK into a powerful socialist nation independent in politics, self-supporting in the economy and self-reliant in defence, holding aloft the banner of independence.
					
					 They went on:
					
					 The Juche revolutionary cause pioneered by Kim Il Sung was steadfastly carried forward by leader Kim Jong Il and is being successfully carried on by Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Speakers including the department head of the School of International Relations of Mongolian National University noted after watching the documentary "Pyongyang today" that the conversion of Pyongyang into such a splendid city from the war debris was the shining fruition of the wise leadership of Kim Il Sung. 
					
					 The manager of the Senat Ship and Trading Private Limited Co. of Singapore praised Kim Il Sung as a great statesman recognized by the world, adding that he would always live in the hearts of not only the Korean people but also all other progressive people.
					
					 The general director of an Indonesian company noted that he was pleased to hear the news that Kim Jong Un issued an order to mercilessly wipe out the enemies if they provoke the DPRK even a bit.
					
					 He fully supported all the measures taken by the DPRK to cope with the moves of the hostile forces.

articles.title: DPRK's Just Cause Supported by Organizations of Indonesia, Bulgaria
articles.content:
DPRK's Just Cause Supported by Organizations of Indonesia, Bulgaria
 Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- Organizations of Indonesia and Bulgaria in their statements on March 27 expressed conviction that the just cause of the Korean people is sure to win.
					 The Indonesian Federation of Transport Workers Unions accused the U.S. of prodding the United Nations Security Council into cooking up the "resolutions on sanctions" against the DPRK, labeling its satellite launch "a long-range missile launch." It is staging joint military exercises to stifle the DPRK with huge armed forces involved, the federation noted, demanding the U.S. stop them at once.
					
					 It fully supported all proposals advanced by the DPRK to defend the security and sovereignty of the country, defuse the U.S. threat of a nuclear war and ensure peace on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 It also voiced firm solidarity with the army and people of the DPRK in their struggle for the peaceful reunification of the country.
					
					 The Bulgarian Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism said:
					
					 The moves of the U.S. and its followers to stifle socialist Korea resulted in the fabrication of the UN Security Council's "resolutions on sanctions," large-scale military exercises and moves for a nuclear war.
					
					 The south Korean bellicose forces backed by the U.S. have committed such extreme provocation as disclosing their operation to bring down the monuments to the great leaders profoundly revered by the Korean people and all other progressive peoples.
					
					 To cope with the prevailing grave situation the Supreme Command of the Korean People's Army issued an order to the strike force of justice to be on a maximum alert and the DPRK Foreign Ministry in a statement said that all the Korean people would start a final all-out action against the U.S.
					
					 We fully support the self-defensive steps of the Korean people to defend the sovereignty of the country and socialism from the U.S. and its allies' aggression.
					
					  The Korean people's just cause is sure to triumph.

articles.title: DPRK's Measures to Defend Its Sovereignty Supported by Foreign Personages
articles.content:
DPRK's Measures to Defend Its Sovereignty Supported by Foreign Personages
 Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- Personages of Democratic Congo and Bangladesh issued statements on March 29 and 31 in support of the statements of the Supreme Command of the Korean People's Army and the Foreign Ministry of the DPRK (Democratic People's Republic of Korea).
					 Otete Gaston Mboyo, deputy general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Democratic Congo who is also chairman of the Democratic Congo-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Association, accused the U.S. of staging large-scale war drills against the DPRK in collusion with the south Korean regime from March 1, bringing the dark clouds of a nuclear war to hang over the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 The measures taken by the Supreme Command of the KPA to cope with the hostile forces' dangerous moves for a nuclear war are entirely just ones to protect the country's sovereignty and the dignity of the nation, he added.
					
					 M. Jahangir Khan, chairman of the Bangladesh Group for the Study of the Songun Policy, said:
					
					 The U.S. ever-escalating hostile acts against the DPRK over its satellite launch have finally pushed the situation to the brink of a nuclear war.
					
					 The U.S. prodded the UN Security Council into fabricating two "resolutions on sanctions" against the DPRK in less than two months, stirring up the vicious cycle of tension in a bid to secure a justification for its anti-DPRK campaign under the signboard of "nuclear non-proliferation."
					
					 We express firm solidarity with the Korean people all out in the final stage of all-out action against the U.S. to protect the sovereignty of the country and the dignity of the nation.
					
					 We also fully support the statement issued by the Foreign Ministry of the DPRK in view of the prevailing grave situation.

articles.title: US Nuclear War Maneuvers Slammed by Moldovan Organizations
articles.content:
US Nuclear War Maneuvers Slammed by Moldovan Organizations
 Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- Moldovan organizations denounced the U.S. imperialists' nuclear war maneuvers against the DPRK (Democratic People's Republic of Korea).
					 The Anti-Imperialist Association of Songun Revolution for the Study of the Juche Idea in Moldova held an emergency meeting on March 28 at which it fully supported the statements of the Supreme Command of the Korean People's Army and the Foreign Ministry of the DPRK.
					
					 The meeting said that the army and people of the DPRK led by the dear respected Kim Jong Un are defending not only their dignity but mankind from a nuclear war, calling upon the world progressives to extend full support to the resolute stand of the DPRK to check the imperialists' aggression and prevent a nuclear disaster.
					
					 The Moldovan Songun Youth Union for the Study of the Juche Idea issued the following appeal on March 30:
					
					 The U.S. warmongers are trying to ignite a nuclear war in Korea.
					
					 The world should denounce the U.S. moves for aggression and support the just stand of the DPRK.
					
					 Progressive people should not remain a passive onlooker to the U.S. high-handed and arbitrary practices.
					
					 If the aggressors unleash a war, they will certainly meet a doom in face of the counteraction taken by the army and people of the DPRK rallied close around Marshal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Hungarian Party Organ Accuses US of Trying to Stifle DPRK
articles.content:
Hungarian Party Organ Accuses US of Trying to Stifle DPRK
 Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- The March 28th issue of the organ of the Hungarian Communist Workers' Party carried an article titled "U.S. preparations for a war against socialist Korea."
					 The paper said that the DPRK (Democratic People's Republic of Korea) does not want a war with the U.S. but the latter works hard to stifle the former.
					
					 It is quite natural for the DPRK to bolster nuclear deterrence to cope with the aggression moves of the U.S. and its followers, the paper noted, and went on:
					
					 There have never been armed forces of the DPRK near the border of the U.S. but the U.S. has posed constant threat to the former after putting south Korea under its military occupation since 1945.
					
					 The international prestige of the DPRK is daily rising and its people are registering achievements in the building of a thriving nation under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 Displeased with this, the U.S. has escalated military tension to disturb the development of socialism in the DPRK.
					
					 The DPRK has the right to protect itself and it will use armed forces, if necessary.

articles.title: DPRK's Stance Supported by Russian, Nepali Personages
articles.content:
DPRK's Stance Supported by Russian, Nepali Personages
 Pyongyang, April 7 (KCNA) -- Personages of Russia and Nepal issued statements on April 1 and 2 in support of the statements of the Supreme Command of the Korean People's Army and the Foreign Ministry of the DPRK.
					 Anatoli Dolgachev, chairman of the Far Eastern Association for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, said that he keenly realized the sagacity of the Songun leadership of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il after witnessing the tragedies in Iraq and Libya.
					
					 He went on:
					
					 Today the world attention is focused on the DPRK.
					
					 The U.S. was frightened by the successful satellite launch and the third nuclear test of the DPRK.
					
					 The service personnel and people of the DPRK are firmly armed with the Juche idea and Songun idea and fully ready to beat back the aggressors.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists are bound to meet a shameful defeat this time, too, as they did in the past Korean War.
					
					 Ram K. Karmacharya, chairman of the Study and Research Forum of Songun Politics of the National Press Club of Nepal, said:
					
					 The homogeneous Korean nation with one and same territory and language is now in the grip of a serious crisis of confrontation between compatriots.
					
					 We think that the reunification of Korea should be achieved in accordance with the June 15 north-south joint declaration which was adopted and published thanks to leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 A peace treaty should be concluded for the reunification of Korea.
					
					 We extend firm solidarity to the Korean people in their just struggle.
